conclusion: Solve by finding force on each segment and calculating total force magnitude
Given: Wire length 2l, V-shape angle 60°, equal arm lengths, magnetic field B perpendicular, current I
Each arm of the V-shape has length l
Force on a straight current-carrying conductor: F = ILBsinθ
Angle between current direction and magnetic field is 90° for both arms, so sinθ = 1
Force on each arm: F_arm = IlB
Define coordinate system: V-shape in xy-plane, magnetic field in z-direction
Arm 2 force vector: F2 = IlB(-sin(60°)i - cos(60°)j)
Substitute sin(60°) = √3/2 and cos(60°) = 1/2 into F2
Total force vector: F_total = F1 + F2 = IlB(-√3/2 i + 1/2 j)
Magnitude of total force: F_total = IlB
Final answer: Magnitude of Ampere force is IlB
